properties.text:
Welcome to the world. First thing is first: you need to survive. For that, you'll need food and shelter.

Look around. Depending on where you are, you'll find plants on the ground that contain edibles.
Erse for the World.
Erse is a fast growing nutritious plant that looks a bit like a strawberry. It tastes nothing like a strawberry. In fact, it tastes pretty bland, but it is good for you.
Corn. Grows fast, grows tall.
Acquiring Hardware

One of the first tools you'll want to make is this simple flint hatchet. The ingredients are simple: sticks come from harvesting the branches and leaves of trees. You do not need to chop the tree down to acquire sticks -- in fact, you cannot harvest the tree's logs without a hatchet.

Flint is acquired as expected: digging through gravel. However, you can also gather flint in sand if gravel proves difficult to find. It might also be wise to make a shovel, especially if you want lots of flint.
The results of a felled tree.

Welcome
   to the
 Stone Age
Index (click on text)
Ore Processing

While there are several methods of processing ore, while we're in the Stone Age, we are very limited. For the most part, you're limited to processing copper, tin, zinc, lead, and silver. The easiest method to process these may be the furnace.
The furnace will allow you to smelt most ores into their ingot forms -- a notable exception to this is iron. Sadly, the heat produced by the furnace is not enough for iron.

At this point, you'll have materials like copper, tin, and zinc. The next step is to turn these into alloys such as bronze and brass. There are two methods to make these alloys: the smeltery and the crucible.

The Smeltery
You'll need grout. There are four different recipes for grout:
Flaked Flint
Most of the more useful tools will require you to knap your flint. Knapping flint is done by holding flint in your hand and hitting the flint against a hard surface, such as stone.
Which, you'll notice, the shovel reqires a station to craft it. You'll also note that planks are a bit harder to acquire. The solution? Wattle or work tables.
Wattle can be used just like planks can, allowing you to craft a normal crafting table.

The Flint Pickaxe
You'll need this to collect stone and ore.

The Work Blade
You'll need a work blade to make wooden pins, which are needed to make the saw, but it has several other uses as well.

The Flint Saw
You may have noticed that planks are harder to craft. You can get around this with a saw. The flint saw is the inferior option, but we can get past that later.

The Stone Gallagher
Once you have a pickaxe, you can make this tool.
Then you just process the grout in the smeltery to make seared bricks. From there, you can make the rest of the smeltery's components.
At a minimum, you'll need a smeltery controller, a tank, a drain, a smeltery faucet, and a casting table or basin.
